results.title: Key Largo
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Jerry Wald and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Frank McCloud (Humphrey Bogart) travels to an island in the Florida Keys to visit the widow of a war buddy. At the hotel where he stays, he encounters crass gangster Johnny Rocco (Edward G. Robinson). Rocco and his henchmen have taken over the hotel and McCloud must decide whether to become involved or to remain aloof. The stage is set for a rich confrontation between Rocco, who is forcefully oppressive and the one man who can do something - McCloud. Based on the play by Maxwell Anderson.

results.title: Junior Bonner
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Joe Wizan and ABC Pictures (US)
results.brief_description: Sam Peckinpah eschews his slow-motion bullet ballets for this quiet character study of ex-rodeo cowboy turned drifter, Junior Bonner, who returns home to Arizona to reconcile with the family he hasn’t seen in years. Bonner is shocked to see that the solid family he was hoping to come back to is breaking apart. His parents, Ace and Elvira, have separated, and his brother Curley has turned into a heartless real estate tycoon, parcelling off sections of his parents’ land for quick money. With nowhere to turn and nowhere to run, Bonner has to face himself and try to find a way to regain his self-respect. Cast includes: Steve McQueen, Robert Preston, Ida Lupino, Ben Johnson and Joe Don Baker.

results.title: Johnny Mnemonic
results.creator_credit: Robert Longo, Don Carmody and ANM
results.brief_description: A snapshot of the future, the year 2021. Corporations rule and the world is threatened by a new plague, NAS; Nerve Attenuation Syndrome. To protect data it must be smuggled through mnemonic carriers who carry the data through a computer chip implanted into the brain; Johnny Mnemonic (Keanu Reeves) is one such carrier. Johnny’s present mission is to carry data from two scientists who have defected from one of the world’s largest corporations, taking the information from Japan to America. The upload of information carried in Johnny’s brain surpasses anything he has carried before and he must find the secret access code that will allow him to download the information, otherwise he will die. Also starring Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi Kitano, Ice-T and Dina Meyer.

results.title: Johnny Guitar
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Herbert J. Yates and Republic Entertainment International
results.brief_description: A reformed gunfighter returns to a woman he had abandoned years earlier. She is now the proprietor of a gambling saloon opened in anticipation of the arrival of the railroad and in the face of hostile opposition from the local townspeople. The film’s bizarre, even baroque, intensity derives in part from the central antagonism between two women (virtually unique in the western), and in Yordan and Ray’s expressed intention of seeking an anti-McCarthy parable.

results.title: John Carpenter's Vampires
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Sandy King and Largo Entertainment
results.brief_description: Mainly working within the parameters of the horror genre, few director’s have the popularity and cult status to warrant their name in the films title, however John Carpenter (“Halloween”, “The Thing”, “Escape from New York”, “Assault on Precinct 13”) has the body of work and the loyal followers to back it up. Based on John Steakley’s novel, “Vampires” stars James Woods as Jack Crow, a sadistic vampire slayer working for the Vatican and searching for the 600 year old originator of the blood curse. Crow and his crew of vampire hunters end up in a small town in New Mexico where they uncover a ‘nest’ of the undead. As bait they use a newly bitten prostitute (Sheryl Lee) who now has telepathic links to the master, in an effort to trap the head bloodsucker. Cast also includes Daniel Baldwin, Thomas Ian Griffith, Maximillian Schell, and Tim Guinee. Music by John Carpenter.

results.title: Jimmy the C
results.creator_credit: Motionpicker Studios, Jimmy the C Productions and Jimmy Picker
results.brief_description: Animated film in which a clay Jimmy Carter (using the voice of Ray Charles) evokes the simpler days prior to his Presidency by singing “Georgia on my mind”, flanked by an American flag and backed by a trio of top-hatted peanuts.

results.title: Jilted
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett, Jenny Day and Mermaid Beach Productions
results.brief_description: Set around a tropical island resort where Al works trying to escape his past, and where Harriet is running from a failed marriage. Both hurt in the past, they become involved - until disturbed by the arrival of another woman. Cast includes Richard Moir, Jennifer Cluff, Steve Jacobs, Tina Bursill and Helen Mutkins.

results.title: Jesus of Nazareth
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, Franco Zeffirelli and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description: This is a special catechetical edition of Zeffirelli’s film, divided into 14 distinct parts, running for a total time of 7 hours. Starring Robert Powell as Jesus Christ, Peter Ustinov as Herod, Olivia Hussey as the Virgin Mary, Michael York as John the Baptist, Anne Bancroft as Mary Magdelene, and James Farentino as the Apostle Peter, this is the tale of the life and death of Jesus Christ, from the time of his birth until his crucifixion.

results.title: Jesus of Nazareth
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, ITC, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Director Franco Zeffirelli’s powerful and compelling epic traces the life of Jesus of Nazareth from Immaculate Conception through to Divine Resurrection. Critically acclaimed and lauded by religious leaders worldwide, a distinguished cast supports Robert Powell and Olivia Hussey in the leading roles of Jesus and Mary.

results.title: Jesus of Montreal
results.creator_credit: Denys Arcand, Pierre Gendron, Roger Frappier, National Film Board of Canada and Max Films
results.brief_description: Daniel is a young actor who, like most of his friends, flits from commercials to stage to television trying to find work. Asked to take on a production of the Passion for a local Church, he finds himself increasingly obsessed with the story of Jesus and his redemption on the Cross. Daniel and the young cast begin to create a retelling of the Passion which resonates with a contemporary audience. However, the radical reworking upsets both the Church and the commercial sponsors who are uncomfortable with the interpretation. “Jesus of Montreal” is a sublime and deeply spiritual film. It is to director Denys Arcand’s credit that he has not only made a film that is ravishing to look at and experience but one which is not afraid to ask the big, difficult questions about life, faith and meaning. Winner of the Jury Prize at the Cannes Film Festival. Winner of a Silver Bear at the Berlin Film Festival.
